children.subject: I can't speak for 188 staff, but the enrollment center information may not be totally up-to-date.
Tried to enroll in CS188 but it still wouldn't allow time conflicts for some reason. How can I get this resolved?
There's a form linked on the class guide - did you fill it out?
Does this mean that although CS 188 is default in person according to the enrollment center, we're able to complete the class fully-remote as well?
"If it's not listed here, we don't know yet, so no need to ask."
Do you think fully-remote students in CS 160 can also get support?

There are supplemental forms. We'll have a pinned thread soon with all the forms. 

Most of us are still waiting on exact details about budget and such, so once that is received I'd imagine all the summer classes will release the supplemental forms.
We could just reuse this post to link the supplemental forms, but yeah, we're waiting on the universal application to open before releasing supplemental forms.
Are the supplemental forms for ASE positions? If so, is the universal application for Summer 2022 also open?
I'll try to bring this up on Friday and get back to you.
Any updates on this?
Sorry, we were busy with other things on Friday - I'll link this in Slack and get updates from the summer instructors.

For now, I'd move forward with the assumption that staff need to be physically present in Berkeley over the summer. In past summers (including remote ones), the department has often been unable to hire people who weren't in the state or country, and I imagine those issues are still present this summer. Also, the university hasn't fully endorsed remote support over the summer, so we're going to be careful about hiring decisions that might potentially jeopardize remote support for students.
<md>CS61BL will be hiring at least a _few_ remote enabled staffers.</md>
If some classes Fully-remote support, is it possible to be an ASE for a class while also being remote?
According to the class guide, no.
Where can I find the class guide.
https://classes.berkeley.edu/content/2022-summer-compsci-70-001-lec-001
Will CS 70 ever be offered remotely? :(

I don't think anyone really knows what in-person/remote options will look like a semester from now.

Disclaimer: I don't teach CS 70, but my personal experience from taking it and talking with TAs has been that theory-based classes especially benefit from being able to work together with your peers and diagram out things in-person. If nothing else, communicating online about math equations is a lot harder than posting code!
So there is no way we could take 70 remotely?
<md>CS61BL: Ethan Ordentlich, Jedidiah Tsang, and Zoe Plaxco</md>
I'll update the top post with instructor names!
Who are the instructors for each class?
According to the class guide, no.
Could CS 70 be taken remotely?
Once they're finalized and ready to announce, the top post will be updated.
<md>Updated: Divija Hasteer and Moses Won</md>
Congrats ^^ :clap:
Who are the instructors for EECS16B?
This is probably a question for your advisor. The summer instructors aren't in charge of the enrollment system.
I have been unable to sign up for Summer Classes. I do not have any holds on  CalCentral as well! Can someone help me please? The class that I was planning on taking is already waitlisted.
Can 160 instructors update us about the remote option during the summer?

I'll ping them, but to reiterate, "If it's not listed here, we don't know yet, so no need to ask." Expansion in summers is usually dependent on our ability to hire enough qualified staff, and we haven't started hiring yet, so my guess is we won't have this information available yet.

Thanks for the ping @Peyrin!

We are going to try to expand the class as much as possible, but we are limited by room capacities. However, I think it is very likely that at your position you would be added to the class. No promises, though (as much as I've tried, I don't have much control over this atm) 

To answer the other question, we are committed to making the course as accessible to remote students as possible.

Thanks for all the hard work trying to expand and have more students take the class.

I'm actually trying to enroll in 160 (haven't yet due to some CalCentral issues), and I've been kinda stressed about getting into the class. The idea of learning more about HCI and possibly learning/practicing how to improve individuals' experiences with technology, creating new technology that meets people's unique needs, making things more accessible, inventing creative solutions to solve complex challenges across a variety of interdisciplinary fields such as education, and more is exciting! It's something I've wanted to learn/explore since like preschool lol.

So, I'm just over here, stressing about when I can enroll. :')

Thank you very much for the response! 

I hope you can accommodate us all! I wanted to take this class Summer 2021, but I could not make it because the class was full and the class was not expanded. So, I really hope I can make it this summer since it will hopefully be my last summer at Cal!

Thanks!
@Shm any idea if you will still  accommodate remote students next summer or is it too early to tell?
Yes, I added the info above that we will accommodate fully remote students as best we can. :-)
I am in position 24 on waitlist for 160. Will I get added to the class?
16A will be conducted in-person. We'll have options for remote lectures and discussions, but will only be holding exams and labs in-person.
What if I can take exams in person but not labs? Is lab weekly and part of grade?
Unfortunately, lab is a weekly part of the grade and, in order to keep things as smooth as possible, we won't have an online option for lab.
Is there any update for EECS16A? Would love to take it remotely..
TAs are usually hired for 20 hours of work per week in the summer.
Would like to add that as a head TA, you may spend >20 hours some weeks, and probably working for a week or 2 before the course starts.
Any idea on what the time commitment is like for teaching positions over summer? I’d like to finalize my summer plans soon, and this would really help. Thanks!

<md>i'm pretty sure "Fully-remote students supported" applies to all components of a course. and i don't teach 161 so maybe peyrin can confirm, but i don't think they've had an attendance requirement for a loooong time (and highly doubt this is going to change, especially if they're planning on supporting remote students).

generally speaking, summer courses don't have as many lecture attendance requirements, as many students balance summer courses with jobs and so can't guarantee that they can make it to lecture at a specific time.</md>
We're not taking attendance, and you can take exams remotely.
Would CS161 also have remote option for exams this summer? Can I watch all the lectures asynchronously or would live attendance be required? Thanks!
also is 161 not hiring reader's, there is no option on the supplemental app?
Depends on the class, probably. For 161, I think missing a reader option there is an oversight on our part, so let me check and get back to you.
<md>any update on this?</md>

Depending on the budget situation, we may not hire readers over the summer. If we do choose to hire readers, we'll probably hire readers from the TA applicant pool; readers for 161 generally become TAs eventually, so we usually prioritize hiring readers who intend to become TAs in a future semester. Feel free to follow up if you still have questions!
<md>will being a ta require you to be on campus? I'd like to be a TA/reader for 161 but I also have a 9-5 summer job and I'm wondering if there is a position that can work around this</md>

We should be able to hire a few people who aren't physically on campus, but this will require approval from the department/hiring staff. Also, when hiring, I think we would prioritize in-person TAs for certain roles (e.g. student support, office hours). Beyond that, I can't make any promises.
do reader's also need to fill out the supplemental app?
I can't speak for other classes, but for 61C at least, probably not until TA/tutor hiring is finished.
When will the application for Academic Intern be released?
Expansion in summers is usually dependent on our ability to hire enough qualified staff, and we haven't started hiring yet, so my guess is we won't have this information available yet.
Do you know if CS70’s going to expand the capacity? I’m on waitlist 51 right now..

We'll probably have in-person lectures that we'll stream over Zoom, so you can attend fully remotely if you want. The class itself will probably be hybrid (both in-person and remote options available).

Calcentral says CS 61C will be held in-person at Li Ka Shing, so I was just wondering if I should follow with the information stated on this post or go with the one on Calcentral. Just for clarification — is 61C fully remote?

1. Not sure what requirement you're referring to here. As I understand it, the policy this summer is if you're in the US, we can hire you, and if you're not in the US, we can't hire you, regardless of whether you've been an ASE in the past or not.

2. Not totally sure about this one, unfortunately - what kind of approval are you looking for? Maybe we can approve you for an exam as a prospective TA, or we can arrange for classes to give you a "hard no" or a "maybe" so you know whether you'll need to take the exam.

1. I wanted to ask about the requirement for undergraduates to have been ASEs in the past. Does this mean having been cleared through ERSO or does it mean an ASE in the EECS department? I have a role as a tutor in the Center for Academic and Engineering Excellence and have been cleared by ERSO for the same as well.
2. I wanted to ask about the international student language screening requirement. The exam form itself says that I would need approval before I am able to take the test as an undergraduate. However, the deadline to take the exam is the same date as the application deadline. I have confirmed with some of the instructors that it would be impossible for them to give me approval before the application deadline since other applications would still be coming in.

<md>you should be able to go to the [deptapps page](https://deptapps.coe.berkeley.edu/ase/eecs/apply), and it should say "Summer 2022 application submitted." you should also get an email confirmation, so if you didn't, then it probably didn't go through.</md>

I just submitted the universal ASE application but didn't get any sort of email confirmation, nor could I find a way to access the submitted application. Is there any way to confirm that the application was indeed submitted successfully?
I don't think there's an official page (maybe I'll try and write one up at some point), but in general, TAs over the summer are hired at 20h/week.
What are the hour options for TAs over the summer? Is there a page that tells this info in general?
Yeah, but we aren't doing fall hiring until the universal application for fall is out. See @16543_f14 for more details on reader hiring.
So 161 will be offered in the fall?
Most likely, yes.
will 161 be hiring readers/ta's in the fall?

For staff hires? It's going to vary by class, but historically we start finalizing staff around mid-April and almost always get it done before the end of the spring semester.

For specific classes, I can only speak for 61C and 161, which are both aiming for end of April to finalize staff.
Is there an approximate time for which we can expect to hear results by?

We highly do not recommend it. We will be teaching an in person course with some remote options for students who temporarily won’t be able to be in person. We will not promise that all support will be available online (tutoring section , oh, etc.). We recommend only taking 61a if you will be in Berkeley for the summer
would it be appropriate to enroll in cs61a's summer session with the intention of taking it remotely, under the assumption that remote-based exams would be supported?
Wow, yeah. Thanks for catching the typo, Sylvia. I've updated the post.
Congrats on the position!
Damn Kendrick beat me to it :)

> EECS 16B: Divija Hasteer, Moses Won (email questions to eecs16b-su20@berkeley.edu)

Is this a typo for eecs16b-su22@berkeley.edu?
Gear 2's comment and Shm's response here @16543_f10

Collaboration and live participation is really important to CS160; it’s an intensive, collaborative course with an involved workload. The course is also in high demand even after expansion, with many students on the waitlist.

I'd ask each student seriously consider whether they can fully dedicate time to the course and to their project-collaborators even with a time conflict, and if they might rather take a different course and give their CS160 seat to a student who can fully participate.
Are we going to learn creating web/phone applications in CS160?
Yes, you’ll be building web applications, some targeted for users with mobile devices, with a focus on designing and developing user-centered interfaces and interactions. :-)
Does CS160 allow time conflict?
61a will try to release the AI app within the week
When will the application for Academic Intern for CS61A and CS61B be open for Summer 2022?
Yep, you're good.
I'm now enrolled in 161 waitlist position #1. I plan to take the class fully remotely, just wanted to double check that I've got nothing to worry about and can happily join along this summer from NYC
Tutor no, TA unsure
Have 61b TA/Tutor offers been sent out yet? Thanks!
In the process
Hi! I'm wondering if there are any updates on the hiring process of CS 70 in summer.
Please feel free to email us if you need to hear back soon. We have sent out an initial round of offers.
has CS 70 sent out interview/offers yet?
The most recent information I've heard is that the department is capping it at 200 for the time being. Never mind, see below
Actually, it seems likely that we can expand at this moment
Hi! Does anyone know if CS 70 is likely to expand for Summer 2022?

Yes we'll have at least one remote discussion - haven't discussed how large it would be, but it wouldn't be unreasonably large. We haven't finished discussing remote accommodations for lectures, but at the minimum they'll be recorded.
Do you anticipate that the remote discussion will be able to accomodate everyone who wants to enroll in it?

When CS70 says that it will have a few remote options does this include the possibility of a remote discussion and or possibly recorded lectures? If remote discussions are on the table is there any estimate as to how large they would be?
Probably a question for the Data 001 Piazza.
Is Data C8 supported remote?
We expect the essentially all students to take the exams in person and will offer remote exams as needed.
For CS70, will remote exams be offered?
For TA or tutor?
We’ve just sent out update emails to nearly everyone in the process.
Have all 61B offers been sent yet? I heard some got it.
Depends on the specific class, but most classes should be done or almost done sending out TA offers.
so if your name was submitted to the department for a position but you have not yet heard back from the department, do you assume that you did not get the position?
Not necessarily; I'd check with the class that you're applying for.
Have the department offers for summer TAs gone out yet?
We will have remote lectures.

Is there any updates on if we can watch CS 70 lectures asynchronous remotely? 

I know it says CS 70: The class will be taught primarily IN-PERSON with few remote options. (from class guide) but I was not sure what few remote options meant and if that included remote lectures.

Thank you!

We do not plan to offer CS 47B over the summer.

Because it is self-study, even during Fall/Spring semesters we make students talk with faculty or the CS Advisers about the enrollment info - there's a vetting process which is why you won't find the class listed for enrollment directly on CalCentral.
If I'm a DS major, do I talk to DS Advisors or CS Advisors in order to take it this Fall?
Is CS47B offered during the summer?  I couldn't find it on CalCentral.
Any word on the ETA for when CS70 Reader will be done hiring?

history.content:
All information/relevant links for summer classes will be collected in this post.

Remote Support

If it's not listed here, we don't know yet, so no need to ask.

  • CS 10: The class will be taught primarily IN-PERSON with some remote options.
  • CS 61A: Remote attendance options will be provided for lecture, discussion, and lab. Exams will be administered in-person, with remote accommodations provided on an as-needed basis. Explicit support will not be made for students taking the course from a non-Pacific timezone. More details will be made available as we continue planning
  • CS 61BL: Fully-remote students supported
  • CS 61C: Fully-remote students supported
  • CS 70: The class will be taught primarily IN-PERSON with few remote options. (from class guide)
  • CS 160: Fully-remote students supported
  • CS 161: Fully-remote students supported
  • CS 162: Fully-remote students supported
  • CS 188: Fully-remote students supported
  • EECS 16A: The class will be taught IN-PERSON. Remote attendance options will be provided for lectures and discussions. Labs and exams will have required in-person attendance.
  • EECS 16B: Fully-remote students supported

Instructors and Contact Info

If it's not listed here, we don't know yet, so no need to ask.

  • CS 10: Madeleine LaBute and Deeksha Kumar
  • CS 61A: Cooper Bedin, Richard Roggenkemper, Jamie Hong (email questions to cs61a@berkeley.edu)
  • CS 61BL: Ethan Ordentlich, Jedidiah Tsang, and Zephyr Barkan (email questions to cs61bl@berkeley.edu)
  • CS 61C: Caroline Liu, Justin Yokota, and Peyrin Kao (email questions to cs61c@berkeley.edu)
  • CS 70: Tarang Srivastava, Jingjia Chen, Kevin Zhu (email su22@eecs70.org)
  • CS 160: Shm Garanganao Almeda and Diyah Mettupalli (email questions to cs160@berkeley.edu)
  • CS 161: Fuzail Shakir and Peyrin Kao (email questions to cs161-staff@berkeley.edu)
  • CS 162: Edward Zeng and Rahul Kumar (email questions to cs162@eecs.berkeley.edu)
  • CS 188: Angela Liu and Yanlai Yang (email questions to cs188@berkeley.edu)
  • EECS 16A: Shreya Ramachandran, Emma Wawrzynek, Mohsin Sarwari (email questions to eecs16a@berkeley.edu)
  • EECS 16B: Divija Hasteer, Moses Won (email questions to eecs16b-su22@berkeley.edu)

Supplemental Application Forms

Deadline: March 18, 2022.

For all classes: fill out the universal application.

Note that for summer, the campus is not authorized to hire applicants who are not in the US.

  • CS 61BL
  • CS 61C
  • CS 70

  • EECS 16B
